narrative.title: Trail to the Hut
paragraphs: The stuffies sprinted down the trail, pushing aside thorny branches as they reach out again and again to clear a path. They soon stumbled into a small clearing and spotted an oddly shaped hut hidden among tangled roots. Before they could look closer, a haunting howl rolled through the trees, urging them forward.

vocabulary.definition: Past tense of sprint. Sprint means to run very fast for a short time.
examples: She sprinted across the field to catch the ball.
He sprinted to the bus stop.

vocabulary.definition: To stretch your arm or hand toward something.
examples: She tried to reach out and grab the rope.
He would reach out to help his friend stand.

vocabulary.definition: Past tense of stumble. Stumble means to trip or nearly fall.
examples: He stumbled on a loose stone.

vocabulary.definition: A small, simple house or shelter.
examples: The hut stood alone in the woods.
They found a warm hut to rest in.

vocabulary.definition: Twisted together in a messy or confusing way.
examples: Her hair was tangled after the windy day.
The path was tangled with roots and vines.

vocabulary.definition: In a strange or unusual way.
examples: The door was oddly warm to the touch.
She spoke oddly, as if unsure of herself.

vocabulary.definition: Staying in your mind in a sad or mysterious way.
examples: The haunting melody stayed with him all night.

events.text: The group runs quickly down a rough forest path.
They try to clear the way as they move.
They enter a small open space and spot a strange building.
A chilling sound echoes from somewhere nearby.

distractors: They find a calm, sunny meadow.
A toy waves from a cozy cottage.
A smooth, paved road appears ahead.
